results.adx_keywords: Soccer;World Cup 2022 (Soccer);Beer;Alcoholic Beverages;Stadiums and Arenas;International Federation of Association Football (FIFA);Anheuser-Busch InBev NV;Qatar
results.title: Ban on Beer Is Latest Flash Point in World Cup Culture Clash
results.abstract: Qatar’s about-face on alcohol signaled that FIFA, soccer’s governing body, may no longer be in full control of its showcase championship.

media.caption: Qatar’s ban on beer in stadiums complicated FIFA’s relationship with Budweiser, which pays $75 million every four years to be associated with the World Cup.
media.copyright: Patrick T. Fallon/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Workplace Environment;Engineering and Engineers;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.byline: By Ryan Mac, Mike Isaac and Kellen Browning
results.title: Elon Musk’s Twitter Teeters on the Edge After Another 1,200 Leave
results.abstract: Mr. Musk sent emails on Friday asking to learn about Twitter’s underlying technology as key infrastructure teams have been decimated.

media.caption: Twitter’s headquarters in San Francisco. So many workers have left that Twitter users have questioned whether the site would survive.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Prisons and Prisoners;Venture Capital;Start-ups;Frauds and Swindling;Tests (Medical);Computers and the Internet;Balwani, Ramesh;Holmes, Elizabeth (1984- );Theranos Inc
results.title: Elizabeth Holmes Is Sentenced to More Than 11 Years for Fraud
results.abstract: Ms. Holmes was convicted in January of four counts of wire fraud for deceiving investors with claims about her blood testing start-up Theranos.

media.caption: Elizabeth Holmes with her partner, Billy Evans, at the federal courthouse in San Jose, Calif., on Friday. She was convicted of four charges of fraud in January.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Computers and the Internet;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Privacy;Musk, Elon;Twitter;Federal Trade Commission;Senate
results.byline: By Ryan Mac, Mike Isaac and David McCabe
results.title: Resignations Roil Twitter as Elon Musk Tries Persuading Some Workers to Stay
results.abstract: Mr. Musk, Twitter’s new owner, had given employees a Thursday deadline to decide whether to leave or stay “to build a breakthrough Twitter 2.0.”

media.caption: Elon Musk and his advisers held meetings with some Twitter workers to try to stop them from leaving.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Musk, Elon;Twitter;United States
results.title: I Was the Head of Trust and Safety at Twitter. This Is What Could Become of It.
results.abstract: Elon Musk’s brand of radical transformation has unavoidable limits.

results.adx_keywords: Antitrust Laws and Competition Issues;Fans (Persons);Music;Box Office Sales;Swift, Taylor;Federal Trade Commission;Live Nation Entertainment Inc;Ticketmaster
results.byline: By David McCabe and Ben Sisario
results.title: Justice Dept. Is Said to Investigate Ticketmaster’s Parent Company
results.abstract: The inquiry predates the botched presale of Taylor Swift tickets this week and is said to focus on whether Live Nation has abused its power in the live music industry.

media.caption: An overwhelming number of presale ticket buyers for Taylor Swift’s concert tour crashed Ticketmaster’s systems this week.
media.copyright: Krista Schlueter for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2024;News and News Media;Presidential Election of 2020;Murdoch, Rupert;Poole, Keith (Editor);Trump, Donald J;New York Post;News Corporation
results.title: New York Post Takes Aim at Trump, and Hits a Nerve
results.abstract: The paper’s increasingly harsh coverage has gotten the news media and political worlds talking about whether the Murdoch media empire has broken permanently from the former president.

media.caption: Two days after the midterm elections, the paper illustrated former President Donald J. Trump as Trumpty Dumpty about to have a great fall.

results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Colleges and Universities;Chapin, Ethan (d 2022);Mogen, Madison (d 2022);Kernodle, Xana (d 2022);Goncalves, Kaylee (d 2022);University of Idaho;Moscow (Idaho)
results.byline: By Rachel Sun, Mike Baker, Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs and Serge F. Kovaleski
results.title: 4 University of Idaho Students Killed in ‘Crime of Passion’
results.abstract: The authorities were still piecing together what had transpired at a home near the University of Idaho campus.

media.caption: Officers are investigating the deaths of four University of Idaho students at an apartment complex south of campus on Sunday. The authorities said they were treating the case as a homicide.
media.copyright: Zach Wilkinson/The Moscow-Pullman Daily News, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Vaccination and Immunization;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Clinical Trials;Research;Science and Technology;your-feed-healthcare;Biden, Joseph R Jr
results.title: The End of Vaccines at ‘Warp Speed’
results.abstract: Financial and bureaucratic barriers in the United States mean that the next generation of Covid vaccines may well be designed here, but used elsewhere.

media.caption: While government funding helped to protect pharmaceutical companies in 2020 from the downsides of spending heavily on tricky vaccine research, there are no such assurances in 2022.

results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;Ticket Scalping;Fans (Persons);Swift, Taylor;Ticketmaster
results.byline: By Ben Sisario and Madison Malone Kircher
results.title: Ticketmaster Cancels Sale of Taylor Swift Tickets After Snags
results.abstract: After a presale for the pop star’s Eras Tour ended in chaos earlier this week, the ticket broker canceled its plans to sell tickets to the general public on Friday.

media.caption: Ticketmaster has canceled its planned public sale of tickets to Taylor Swift’s latest tour, which was scheduled for Friday, after a series of problems with its earlier presales.

results.adx_keywords: Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Elections, House of Representatives;Boebert, Lauren;Republican Party;Colorado
results.title: Lauren Boebert’s Rival, Adam Frisch, Concedes Their Colorado House Race
results.abstract: Ms. Boebert and Mr. Frisch have been locked in one of the country’s closest contests as she seeks a second term in the House.

media.caption: Representative Lauren Boebert of Colorado faced a strong challenge from Adam Frisch, a Democrat who had sought to cast her as a flamethrower in an increasingly polarized Congress.
media.copyright: Anna Rose Layden for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Weather;Snow and Snowstorms;National Weather Service;Buffalo (NY);Lake Erie;Hamburg (NY);Lackawanna (NY);Lake Ontario
results.byline: By Jesse McKinley, Judson Jones and Michael D. Regan
results.title: More Than 5 Feet of Snow in Buffalo Area, and More Is Expected
results.abstract: A storm lasting through the weekend is underway on the eastern coasts of Lakes Erie and Ontario, with snowfall rates reaching over three inches per hour.

media.caption: Clearing snow from a road outside Buffalo.
media.copyright: Brendan Bannon for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Frauds and Swindling;Start-ups;Tests (Medical);Computers and the Internet;Holmes, Elizabeth (1984- );Theranos Inc
results.title: Elizabeth Holmes’s Fraud Sentence Will Send a Message One Way or Another
results.abstract: Ms. Holmes, founder of the failed blood testing start-up Theranos, is scheduled to learn her fate on Friday. She faces a maximum of 20 years in prison.

media.caption: More than 100 letters have been filed in support of Elizabeth Holmes, who left court last month with her partner, Billy Evans.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, House of Representatives;Boebert, Lauren;Frisch, Adam (1967- );Republican Party;Democratic Party;Colorado
results.title: Lauren Boebert’s House race is nearing a recount.
results.abstract: The race, in Colorado’s Third Congressional District, is one of the few that remain undecided. Adam Frisch, the Democratic challenger, trails Ms. Boebert, the Republican incumbent, by 551 votes.

media.caption: Representative Lauren Boebert at a debate in September.
media.copyright: William Woody for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: vis-photo;Capitol Building (Washington, DC);United States Politics and Government;Women and Girls;Records and Achievements;Impeachment;Midterm Elections (2022);Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Photography;Pelosi, Nancy;Trump, Donald J;Democratic Party;House of Representatives
results.title: Portrait of a Speaker: Nancy Pelosi’s Most Enduring Moments
results.abstract: From becoming the first woman speaker to leading the impeachments of Donald J. Trump, Nancy Pelosi has been one of the most visible women in Washington.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Special Prosecutors (Independent Counsel);Presidential Election of 2024;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Garland, Merrick B;Trump, Donald J
results.byline: By Glenn Thrush, Charlie Savage, Maggie Haberman and Alan Feuer
results.title: Garland Names Special Counsel for Trump Inquiries
results.abstract: Even before Mr. Garland’s announcement, there were signs that prosecutorial activity in both cases was accelerating after a brief slowdown in the run-up to the midterm elections.

media.caption: The appointment of a special counsel was a way for Attorney General Merrick B. Garland to insulate the Justice Department’s investigations from political considerations.

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);Teachers and School Employees;Education;your-feed-opinionvideo
results.byline: By Agnes Walton and Nic Pollock
results.title: Empty Classrooms, Abandoned Kids: Inside America’s Great Teacher Resignation
results.abstract: It’s never been harder to oversee America’s classrooms, and it’s driving educators out en masse.

results.adx_keywords: Sheriffs;Traffic Accidents and Safety;Minks (Animals);Agriculture and Farming;Animals;internal-sub-only;Ohio;Van Wert (Ohio);Indiana;United States
results.title: About 10,000 Mink Are Running Loose in Northwest Ohio
results.abstract: The Van Wert County sheriff said a local highway had to be cleared of dead mink and warned residents not to try to capture the animals on their own.

media.caption: Mink on a farm near Naestved, Denmark, in 2020. The mink released in Ohio were domesticated and unlikely to have the skills to survive in the wild.
media.copyright: Mads Claus Rasmussen/Ritzau Scanpix, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Vaccination and Immunization;Coronavirus Omicron Variant;Immune System;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Antibodies;Disease Rates;Research;Pfizer Inc;Novavax Inc
results.title: Will Covid Boosters Prevent Another Wave? Scientists Aren’t So Sure.
results.abstract: The shots may help vulnerable Americans dodge serious illness or death. But some experts believe boosters must be improved and are calling for a new strategy.

media.caption: A vaccine event in Maywood, Ill., in September. Only about 10 percent of adults in the nation have opted for the latest booster, suggesting that many are disenchanted with — or unaware of — the new shot.
media.copyright: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Prisons and Prisoners;Sheriffs;Assaults;Prison Guards and Corrections Officers;Cameras;Hobbs, Jarrett;Camden County (Ga);Georgia
results.title: Georgia State Agency Investigating Jail Beating Caught on Camera
results.abstract: The videos, which began circulating on Monday, show officers entering the cell where Jarrett Hobbs was held at the Camden County jail in Woodbine, Ga., and punching him repeatedly.

media.caption: Security camera footage showing Jarrett Hobbs and multiple officers in a cell at the Camden County Safety Complex on Sept. 3.
